paragraph.paragraph: The Eiffel for .NET Compliance Checker tool can be used to verify assemblies written in other .NET languages; such as C#, VB.NET, IL, Cobolt, Delphi, etc. are Eiffel-Compliant and/or CLS-Compliant. The tool checks the Common Language Specification (CLS) consumer (generally a .NET compiler) related rules for CLS-Compliance and Eiffel's more lax consumer rules. That is to say Eiffel for .NET's ability to consume non-CLS-Compliant assemblies, types and their members.

The Eiffel for .NET Compliance Checker tool is for verification only! It will allow you, a developer or component vendor, to ensure any number of .NET assemblies can be used from within Eiffel. In addition it also highlights potential problems CLS-strict languages will have consuming assemblies you yourselves have developed. You may then go back to your code and mark assemblies, types and members with the System.ClsCompliantAttribute attribute, with the appropriate state flag. The tool will also indicate illegal compliance, indicating a System.ClsCompliantAttribute state flag is incorrectly specified or a require System.ClsCompliantAttribute attribute is missing.
paragraph.note: Note: The current version of this tool will only check .NET framework version 1.0 and 1.1 and who's Eiffel-compliancy relates to the following product versions: EiffelEnvision 2.6, Eiffel for ASP.NET 5.6, EiffelStudio 5.7
